result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery M Robers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffery M Robers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Jeffery M Robers was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffery M Robers is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Jeffery M Robers was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Jeffery M Robers was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Jeffery M Robers was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today September 12, 2016.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Jeffery M Robers appeared.  Court called.  Court and attorneys have reviewed the PSI and have no changes.  Attorneys make sentencing arguments.  DE makes statement.  Crt orders:

Ct. 2, Ct 3 & Ct 4 to run concurrent with any  current probation

W/S 2 years probation with conditions

- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment or therapy

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- DE ordered to pay $1,000 in total for court costs and one DNA surcharge for the felony/apply the $1,000 on file

- DE to sign up for probation today 09/12/16 

- DE's bond to remain in effect until he signs up for probation and then it is vacated

- 20 days to appeal
Sentencing hearing on September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: State Exhibits 1 - 14 (per ADA McKinley 3/31/16 - does not want the exhibits back). eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley supervising certified attorney Kindra Seifert, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Jeffery M Robers appeared.  Court called at 9:18 a.m.  Set for Court Trial.  Court reviews DE's right to a jury trial with the DE.  Court finds the DE freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a jury trial.  State offers Ex. 7 (Certified Records/Priors) O/R, Ex. 8 (OWI Conviction) O/R, Ex. 9 (OWI Conviction) O/R, Ex. 10 (JOC Possession THC) O/R, Ex. 11 (JOC Possession THC) O/R, Ex. 12 (JOC Possession THC) O/R, Ex. 13 (JOC Possession THC) O/R, Ex. 14 (JOC Possession THC) O/R.  Ex. 5 (Lab Report) O/R. Attorney Kucinski is stipulating to testimony by the certified nurse that took the blood draw. Ex. 4 O/R (Lab Report) & Ex. 6 (Lab Report) O/R.  Attorney Kucinski is stipulating to Lab results.  S/T of Officer Mark Volz of the North Hudson Police Department.  Direct by Attorney Seifert.  DE is identified by Officer Volz.  State's Ex. 1 (Drug para) O/R. State's Ex. 2 (Drug Para) O/R.  State's Ex. 3 (Informing the Accused) O/R.  Cross by Attorney Kucinski.  Re-direct by Attorney Seifert.  Witness excused.  State rests.  DE rests.  Closing argument by Attorney Seifert.  Closing argument by Attorney Kucinski.  Court dismisses Ct. 1.  Attorney Kucinski continues with closing argument.  Rebuttal by Attorney Seifert.  Court finds the State has met its burden of proof and finds the DE Guilty of Ct. 2, Ct. 3 & Ct. 4.  Court finds the DE Not Guilty of Ct. 5 & Ct. 6.  Court orders a PSI for Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 and Ct. 4 to follow.  Court will schedule the SEH once the DE's PSI has been reviewed.  State does not want exhibits Ex. 3 through Ex. 14 returned.  Officer Volz has custody of Ex. 1 & Ex. 2.  Verified the DE's address.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw
